website_summaries.verdict: Pass on Oxo's 9-Cup Coffee Maker for something cheaper, brews better or both.
pros: The Oxo 9-Cup Coffee Maker brews consistent and drinkable pots of joe
It's attractive and easy to use
cons: It makes coffee that's slightly bitter

customer_reviews.title: Leaky Drip Basket
customer_reviews.text: One month after purchase and the ‘pause and pour’ feature no longer works. In addition, basket continues to drip long after brewing completed whenever carafe is removed. Inspected drip basket and the valve on the bottom sticks in the open position. This is scary for a $200 coffee maker. Requested replacement drip basket; but Amazon unable to replace the drip basket only. Therefore, returning entire unit for refund. Attached photo taken after initial cleanup of first serving, about 2 hours later.
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: Nice idea but poorly made.
customer_reviews.text: I read a good review of this coffee maker in the New York Times and I was in need of a new coffee maker. The first one shipped to me simply did not work so I sent it back and had another sent. The second one worked for about two weeks and then would not fully empty the reservoir so I sent that one back for a refund. It is very flimsy and although it made fine coffee for two weeks overall it was a bad experience. I have had OXO products in the past that worked out well but this was a dud. Poorly made.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Glode

customer_reviews.title: Puddles
customer_reviews.text: The little valve that's supposed to stop the flow so that you can pour during brewing has never worked. It's too tight to close and has been right from day one. I thought it would loosen over time but it hasn't. What that means is that whenever you remove the pot coffee drips out. I'm surprised that a coffee maker that is this expensive would be so poorly designed.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Douglas A Ward

customer_reviews.title: Consistently Great Coffee
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. For example: water fill is see through glass container, filter basket lid flips open 180 degrees, one button/dial to adjust for number of cups, set clock etc. All in all, a well thought out design that makes coffee as good as you would get if you poured water over a filter yourself. Thermal carafe keeps the coffee hot for about one hour and ensures you never get the burnt taste when coffee sits on a hot plate. Deducting one star since it's a bit overpriced. Also because 9 cups is a strange increment and not truly sized to a mug of coffee. Be aware that 9 cups equates to about 3 large size mugs of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hard to clean and overpriced
customer_reviews.text: Your first pot will taste delightful, but after a week, you'll start doubting your beans. It can't be the brand new coffee maker can it? Yes, it is. The bizarre rubber straw.... just don't even use it. That lid to the carafe? Give it a little shake. Hear the liquid squishing around and maybe a subtle click? What were they thinking when they designed that? This unit is horribly overpriced, tricky to clean well, and needlessly large. Although everything tasted great from the first run, the awkward lid makes it a hassle to clean, and if you don't clean it really well, the coffee isn't going to be great.
customer_reviews.author: Hat

customer_reviews.title: Makes wonderful coffee
customer_reviews.text: After too many hours looking for the right coffee maker, I purchased this one. After using it for a few times I thought well yes, this does make a very good cup of coffee. I wondered if it was just me or if it was really the coffee maker. The next 3 or 4 people who stopped by in the mornings all said to me 'This coffee is really good" and that was not prompted by me. Did not change the type of coffee I was using so can only credit the quality to the coffee maker itself. I would for sure buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence D. Luttrell

customer_reviews.title: good but.
customer_reviews.text: i wanted to love this but i wanted a very easy mr coffee put water and press button type of machine and make great coffee this is not it and neither are most coffee machines anymore. i even bought mr coffee to see difference and not much except much cheaper then i found pour over coffee very cheap and makes good but not great coffee and have lots more counter space give it a try. look it up on you tube. pour over coffee. if you have lots of people drinking coffee this is not for you. but you can still do it for 4 people but it's just not a push button type of easy. hope this helps anyone.
customer_reviews.author: rusty90

customer_reviews.title: Love this coffee maker!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this for close to a year now and have never had any issues. We absolutely love it and the quality of the coffee it makes! The first week the “shower head” came off and must have been dumped with the grounds. When we noticed it was missing I called Oxo to buy a replacement and they sent one no charge. It’s never happened since. Coffee stays hot about 6 hrs or more. Longer if you preheat it but we don’t bother. I like the auto function too even though that defeats it for the coffee purists it sure is a welcome thing to wake to in the morning.
customer_reviews.author: Ellie

customer_reviews.title: It's okay, but that's it..
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice coffee maker. It is sleek and looks good on the counter. However, there are a few negatives I have come across: 1. The coffee just doesn't seem hot enough. It seems just warm. 2. It takes time to brew. I replaced an old Bunn coffee maker that was very fast... 3. Condensation remains in the water holder of the coffee pot. I guess I could refill the water after each pot, but I dont want to have water sitting around for a day until I make more coffee. May seem like minor complaints, but I can see replacing this caffee maker in the next few months
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One Fine Cup Of Joe !
customer_reviews.text: Really, this an amazing coffee machine ! I'll stack this up against any coffee house to replicate with this little gem is able to pull off ! It's like night and day from other machines we've owned. The little "brain" is very intelligent, and actually fun to watch how it brews, with dramatic paused as it coordinates blossom, temp, and just the right amount of liquid at all times. Highly recommend if your looking for a unit that is pleasing asthetically on your counter, makes great coffee, and the thermal caraf keeps it at temp for a long long time.
customer_reviews.author: True Review

customer_reviews.title: Programmable, efficient, easy to use, and near-pourover quality.
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this coffee maker. Upon every occasion that I used it, I found that it created a balanced and smooth cup of coffee; in fact, it was so good, I wouldn't believe that it came out of a drip machine. I also got this because I could program it to make the coffee before I woke up, making mornings much easier. Also, an added bonus was being able to wake up to the smell of freshly brewed coffee, which actually ended up reducing the amount of time I spent each morning just laying in bed. Great product! (:
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Damn good cup of Coffee
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to make a cup of coffee that was better than anything I could buy in the morning. So I choose to invest in the best I could find and afford, this was my choice and I am so glad that I did. I also invested in the OXO burr grinder too, figuring that fresh ground beans would give me the edge on the best cup of coffee that I could make myself, and boy was I ever right. Have been using this for about 8 months now and it's a keeper. Guests and family all agree it's a damn good cup of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Hayden

customer_reviews.title: Works Well Albeit Not Quite What Was Pictured
customer_reviews.text: I literally upgraded my review. I still maintain it’s overpriced and far more utilitarian and industrial looking than photos. But here’s the thing: it works. So the heck with the Chinese photography making this look snazzier and more high quality than it is. It works and so I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Vike Savoth

customer_reviews.title: Much more plastic than expected
customer_reviews.text: Not the coffee maker’s fault per se, but just in case you’re like me and you bought this coffee maker because of the dozens of reviews on the internet of “best plastic free coffee makers” then ALL THOSE REVIEWS ARE WRONG. This coffee maker has tons of plastic. The water tank is plastic, the filter basket is plastic, the carafe lid the water passes through is plastic. Nearly everything the water touches while brewing is plastic. Maybe those reviews were talking about the 12 cup model with a kettle (no longer available) who knows. But this model most definitely has tons of plastic. And plastic is specifically what I was trying to avoid.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Cull

customer_reviews.title: quality product
customer_reviews.text: My husband was tired of our Keurig. It was non-programmable and the coffee in the carafe did not stay hot. This is what drove him to the OXO Barista Brain, and he couldn't be happier. It's easy to use, easy to clean, and he loves hot coffee waiting for him in the morning. It's much sleeker than the Keurig, so it takes up less counter space. The coffee is somehow stronger using this machine, so we just use a bit less coffee grounds and so far it's been perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Heather S.

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee, clock malfunction, returning
customer_reviews.text: Lovely machine, makes great coffee, sleek design, love the 60 minute freshness countdown. I returned it, however, as the clock malfunctions every time I make coffee. The clock will be set and then starts blinking "12 hours/24 hours", requiring me to set the clock every single day. I outreached to OXO who reports this is due to a sensor for the clock. For $199, this is unacceptable, no matter how good the coffee is. I"m going to try the Bonavita.
customer_reviews.author: moondance

customer_reviews.title: This is for people who really enjoy the flavor and aroma of real coffee
customer_reviews.text: If your the person that drinks 20 cups a day, stick with your Bunn. If your the person that really enjoys a really great cup of coffee a couple times of day, this it! Wow, this makes real coffee, incredible flavor. Reminds me of when I lived in Europe for a couple years. We grind our own beans which probably helps as well, but the way this coffee maker works with the sprinkler head, perfect heat, and NO burner makes all the difference.
customer_reviews.author: Swen

customer_reviews.title: Poor design
customer_reviews.text: Coffee stained water drips back into water reservoir when basket cover lid is lifted. Water constantly sits in the bottom heating element area even after it is finished brewing and turns off. If you turn it upside down when the reservoir is empty, old water always pours out. Carafe lid holds coffee and must be rinsed several times to avoid old coffee being stuck inside the lid until next use.
customer_reviews.author: Sparky

customer_reviews.title: Other than not-exactly-intuitive controls, this coffee-maker is a winner
customer_reviews.text: The other reviews that talk about the high quality of coffee that this machine brews are correct -- I've never have coffee this good from any other drip coffeemaker. The controls are a dial with a button in the middle -- without the instruction manual, I'd have never figured out how to switch from 24 hour to 12 hour clock (hold down the button for like 10 seconds, and it'll finally show the setting for 12Hr/24Hr). Once you've got that figured out, it's pretty straightforward, but I'm keeping the manual handy for whenever we have a power outage.
customer_reviews.author: A. Richards

customer_reviews.title: Well Designed - And Quiet
customer_reviews.text: Reviewed many before choosing this one. Very happy with purchase. It is well designed and thought out. Large opening in water reservoir for filling, large basket keeps grounds from getting up onto shower head, and basket easy to remove to dump used grounds and filter. Carafe is just pour, nothing to twist or button to push. Water temperature seems to be correct for proper brewing. Unit looks nice, and is the most quiet unit I have ever used by far. And I have to admit, it is cool watching the water go up the brew tube!
customer_reviews.author: CTH

customer_reviews.title: WORTH EVERY PENNY!
customer_reviews.text: PROS: consistent easy clean easy brew No NOISE! (No percolating burps, No obnoxious beeps, no hissing, or chimes) simple programing consistent brews spreads water evenly carafe stays hot up to 8 hours if full CONS: only 9 cups issues with removing the carafe mid brewing sometimes it leaks sometimes it hiccups afterwards SUMMERY: It's truly a great coffee maker designed for the early morning riser. great design simplicity+function+performance.
customer_reviews.author: Northman

customer_reviews.title: Very solid choice makes great tasting coffees and very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I carefully read all the reviews on top rated coffee makers and decided on this one. It does not great tasting coffee and the carafe keeps in fairly hot for about 30 minutes. Excellent flavor. The best is how easy it is to use and program the timer. Reminds me of a nest thermostat. I would give 5 stars if the coffee was hotter and if you could leave the water reserve and the coffee filter sevtion open at the same time. You can only leave one top open at a time and you inevitably get condensation in the other.
customer_reviews.author: MicheleD

customer_reviews.title: get this if you want amazing coffee!! so great
customer_reviews.text: This is the SECOND oxo coffee brewer I have bought. I got this one for my sister because the past two years using my own machine... my god i've had such full-bodied, hot coffee every single morning. I had to make sure my sis got the same. Even my roommates loved to use it, oxo always makes such great quality appliances and kitchen wares! I also had a Breville coffee maker and even though i do really love that australian brand, the coffee came nothing close to what this oxo could make! pro tip - screw the lid on fully and you can pour coffee out of the spout
customer_reviews.author: piggiesmalls

customer_reviews.title: Easy, awesome flavor and heat
customer_reviews.text: After researching independently, my husband and I both landed on this being the best coffeemaker. We love it. Super easy. Comes w spoon that has enough coffee per scoop, stays hot for at least an hour.
customer_reviews.author: stacy

customer_reviews.title: Great, but be sure to check the measurements, if you're short on space
customer_reviews.text: The OXO Barista Brain is a great coffee-maker. It's super easy to use - with only one button to control everything, but doesn't skimp on options, nonetheless. It makes great tasting coffee, which is the point of any coffee-maker, of course, but so few of them actually manage the job. It's simple to set up, and remarkably easy to clean. I was comparing the OXO machine to the Technivorm Moccamaster, and you can't go wrong with either one, but at 2/3 the price of the Moccamaster, the OXO will leave you lots of money to buy more of what you're after, coffee!
customer_reviews.author: Janet Snowhill

customer_reviews.title: OK but no replacement parts
customer_reviews.text: Mine has made good coffee but not "$200 good" coffee. The style is nice and the seeing the water bubble up through the center tube is interesting. The flip cover on mine broke (my fault) but when I contacted support they said they did not sell replacement parts. That's just not OK for a $200 coffee maker. I do not plan to spend that much for its replacement. Before the flip cover broke my only reservations were the odd 9 cup size and the somewhat confusing controls.
customer_reviews.author: KTF

customer_reviews.title: We have had this several weeks now and love it. Purchased based upon Amazon reviews as well ...
customer_reviews.text: We have had this several weeks now and love it. Purchased based upon Amazon reviews as well as Wirecutter. Makes fantastic coffee and the garage keeps it very hot for several hours. Carafe is cool to the touch. Have been trying all blends of coffee with it now that have started enjoying our coffee again. Very simple to set up - easy to set brew time and strength. This thing was also packed like a fine piece of china - quite impressive. Would buy again tomorrow. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: Paul M. Stovall

customer_reviews.title: Leaks water everywhere
customer_reviews.text: I never write reviews, however I felt like this had to be known about this product. It's entirely possible that I received a defective model, but for something that costs upwards of $200, this is product is incredibly disappointing. Upon making coffee, it leaks water all over the countertop as if there is a giant hole in the bottom. The source of it is one of the pads that stabilize the whole system so it's a complete design failure. Easy to clean? Sure. Coffee tastes fine? Yeah not bad. But the fact that a product this expensive would be ill suited to make coffee without causing a complete mess really is incredible.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Tuttle

customer_reviews.title: I don't think this makes very good coffee
customer_reviews.text: i bought this to upgrade from the simple braun drip coffee maker I had in my apartment and my slightly more sophisticated cuisinart one I use at a weekend retreat. I feel wirecutter recommendation is very flawed here. I followed instructions to the letter and even weight coffee and tried both paper and non-disposable filters. Even experimented with small variations in grind size. This maker does not extract enough. The coffee it makes is dull and lacks acid. And it is just too expensive for what it does. Thinking about returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Logan

customer_reviews.title: Lasted for 4 Years & 5 Months.
customer_reviews.text: Made great coffee. Simple to use. Cleaning & maintenance a bit of a chore but to be expected. Lasted for 4 Years & 5 Months. That is long enough for a fairly convenient easy to use water heating type device. We used it at least once daily. Twice most days. Make sure to clean & descale as per instructions to get the best out of this product. Bought a new one a few weeks ago from a different seller. Expecting similar results.
customer_reviews.author: Toxic Rainbow

customer_reviews.title: Underwhelmed, considering price
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker has been a disappointment. Considering I paid $160 on sale, I expected a lot more from this machine. The flavor of the coffee is good, but the valve in the carafe makes an irritating popping sound while brewing. The basket drips more than any other pot I've ever owned, and frequently creates a puddle under the carafe. Without warming up the carafe, the coffee goes cold more quickly than I'd like. Just so many small issues that I didn't expect at this price point and probably would've bought something else had I known.
customer_reviews.author: Gwen

customer_reviews.title: Best coffee machine we have found so far
customer_reviews.text: We are fairly fussy coffee drinkers who get fresh roasted beans, grind just before use, etc. This well built (although mostly some kind of plastic) machine makes excellent coffee. Several nice features and one limitation. The carafe is excellent. It is a true vacuum carafe that keeps coffee piping hot for an hour or more. Has an ingenious lid that keeps it sealed but you can pour immediately. Distributes the water as a "shower" over the grounds. Nicely timed cycle. Automatically turns off. The limitation is the power cord is too short
customer_reviews.author: Doubting Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Design flaw
customer_reviews.text: You'd think they would be able to make the water reservoir removable for easy cleaning. It will smell, and you will not be able to properly clean this unless you can take the reservoir to the sink and wash it out. This thing is tall, so that could present a challenge. There is always a good amount of water left in this after use also. I found that out after turning it upside down over the sink, and water just started pouring out. We’ve never really gotten a good tasting cup of coffee out of this either. It is definitely not worth the money I assure you.
customer_reviews.author: Gabe

customer_reviews.title: Beware first brew
customer_reviews.text: My major complaint echos some others here. The first brew, even after the requisite water brew, is terrible. You truly need to do a couple vinegar brews (fill to max line with 1/2 white vinegar and 1/2 tap water) and a few more water brews to make it taste reasonably like a cup of coffee rather than liquefied racquetballs.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Bushey

customer_reviews.title: low brew temperature, which is kind of a deal breaker.
customer_reviews.text: Overall I liked using this coffee maker, but found the coffee tasted worse over time (despite appropriate cleaning and descaling). I've measured the water temp straight from the brew cycle, and it is between 175 and 185. I will probably stop using it and go back to pour over to have 200° water.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Requires continual resetting or the coffee is lukewarm at best.
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for about a month but then the coffee started to come out lukewarm. Did the reset like I saw online and that fixed the temperature issue for a week or so, but then lukewarm again. Again, reset it and worked for a week or so, now lukewarm again. I didn't pay this much for a coffee maker that I have to reset every few weeks when my morning coffee comes out lukewarm. There are better options out there. I would avoid this.
customer_reviews.author: NJ-Bill

customer_reviews.title: Best Coffee Maker!!
customer_reviews.text: This machine is really amazing. The coffee it produces tastes fantastic. The machine makes absolutely zero sound while brewing[ I did remove the carafe pipe which I didn't find useful] . It should have a notification signal. If you are not paying attention in another room you will have to remember to check the status. The timer is easy to employ. The coffee remains hot in the carafe for nearly three hours after brewing. You can take the carafe with you to another room and place on any unprotected surface. It is not warm/hot at all on the exterior of the carafe. The insulation on this is a thing of beauty.
customer_reviews.author: PinkTwig

customer_reviews.title: A great addition to our kitchen
customer_reviews.text: We are big fans of OXO products and so happy we added this easy to use excellent addition to our kitchen. we wanted a coffee maker that went beyond the call of duty along with being an attractive appliance to add to our counter. Best of all it brews fantastic coffee and keeps it warm and excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Michael B. Deluise

customer_reviews.title: Less than perfect, maybe a fatal flaw.
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking design, makes good coffee, easy to clean, etc. But, the valve in the bottom of the cone sticks open and leaks badly, even with regular cleaning. This valve should stop the flow of coffee when the pot is removed from the base, but due to poor design and a weak spring, it rarely closes and coffee runs out of the cone and onto the base. Also, the pot and the filter cone do not align (see photo). This does not affect function, but I think a $200 coffee maker that aspires to "high design" should have something as basic as this worked out. Seriously considering returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi J. King

customer_reviews.title: Should have paid more attention to the other reviews
customer_reviews.text: Makes great coffee and it is a fun design. BUT the dripping is very annoying. When I read the other reviews that mentioned this I assumed Oxo had fixed there design by now. It not only drips (a lot) when you remove the carafe while brewing, it also drips after brewing is complete. Big mess, should have returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Precious Little Use - Quit Working
customer_reviews.text: I bought this coffee maker in the “like new” condition from the Amazon Warehouse. I’m past the return window and ~ 3 month past the product support assistance. That’s too bad, as this rarely used pot quit this week. I expected much, much more out of this pricey item. I’m happy to report that I almost bought two of these coffee makers, one for my daughter. So at least I didn’t take a chance on double the loss. I almost never leave an unhappy reviews. This one is worthy.
customer_reviews.author: CSW

customer_reviews.title: Best I've Tried
customer_reviews.text: I downsized from the OXO 12 Cup coffee maker, to a Technivorm Moccamaster, mainly because of the overwhelming positive reviews. The first batch of coffee from the Moccamaster was bitter, and a bit watery. I decided to go ahead and buy the OXO 9 Cup to do a comparison, and return the lesser performer. The OXO makers consistently more full flavored, smoother, and richer coffee every time. It is very quiet, has a modern look to it, has a clock/timer, and just works better than any other coffee maker I've had. HIGHLY recommend this to anyone who wants great coffee!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: William Allen Horton

customer_reviews.title: Beats my previous Technivorm hands down!
customer_reviews.text: About 10 years ago I purchased a Technivorm coffee maker and it served me well. A couple of weeks ago, I purchased the Oxo product as a gift for a friend - wow was I impressed with the product and the coffee it made. This is a great coffee maker. You can have coffee brewed when you get to the kitchen. The Carafe is excellent - coffee stays warm longer.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon P

customer_reviews.title: Coffee wasn't hot enough - returned it
customer_reviews.text: The SS carafe sounds like a good idea, except the coffee doesn't come out of the machine hot enough. It's drinkable immediately if black (but still not quite hot enough) and much too cold if milk is added. We had to microwave the coffee immediately after brewing.
customer_reviews.author: D. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Manufacturing Issue
customer_reviews.text: The item showed up in factory packaging that was in perfect condition. The base of the coffee maker was not assembled and had a large gap in the plastic. It also looked like the plastic that the screws should have been into was not molded correctly. The unit was returned to the seller within an hour of opening through Kohls. Really the seller could not have known that status of the unit when shipping. I was a little disappointed when I dropped $200 on a luxury type item to find it in this condition.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pleasing presentation & easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Works great, looks cool on the counter, fun to watch the water bubble up through the system! Although I read a number of reviews that said this made the best cup of coffee, my husband and I don't notice any better performance than with other coffee makers, and we still feel that the taste of the coffee just depends on how we make it. But we make it good! :) It would be easier to clean out the inside of the carafe if the mouth were wider, but I like the sleek look of the narrower opening, and plan to get a brush to give the carafe a good cleaning now and then.
customer_reviews.author: Mary V

customer_reviews.title: Impressive, even to 'traditional' coffee drinkers
customer_reviews.text: Personally my family does not drink coffee. This was purchased as a gift for my VERY non-technical father-in-law. We delivered it to him, set it up and showed him the simple method to make coffee. After our first brew he tasted it and smiled. At that point we knew he was pleased. Since having a quality coffee maker he has been experimenting with different flavors and types to find his favorite. He hasn't stopped yet, and says he still enjoys 'that fancy coffee maker y'all got me'.
customer_reviews.author: dirtvoyles

customer_reviews.title: Makes terrible tasting coffee!
customer_reviews.text: I love the design of the pot and the insulated carafe is great. But I have yet to figure out how to get a good cup of coffee. The first couple of weeks everything had a chemical smell/taste - I guess from the plastic. That wore off after awhile but now the coffee is bitter-all the time. I have tried many different kinds of coffee-all fresh roasted here in my city. I have tried different amounts. I use filtered water. Nothing seems to work! I pulled out my crappy travel pot and the coffee taste better! So sad as now I have missed the 30 day window to return!
customer_reviews.author: uvarunner

customer_reviews.title: Disapointing
customer_reviews.text: Brew temp is inconsistent and inadequate -- 150s to 180s, so no good. Also, carafe does not seem to hold coffee warm for very long. Of course, some of it was not warm enough to begin with!! When the brew temp is up there, coffee is great. Looks nice bubbling up as it brews. Large footprint so be sure that is OK if you buy.
customer_reviews.author: KeyJey

customer_reviews.title: Makes great coffee while it lasts--but it doesn't last long
customer_reviews.text: I indulged my coffee-tooth with this machine, spending more than usual and in terms of the taste of the brew, no complaints. But the machine started having trouble maybe 8 months in--stopping mid-brew and shutting off. And now, a little over a year from when I purchased, it is dead. Kind of short-lived for $200.
customer_reviews.author: holly p. rockwell

customer_reviews.title: Most awful tasting coffee ever
customer_reviews.text: Tried running water through it, different filters, more or less coffee and the taste is always bitter. One problem maybe is that the reservoir smells like plastic. I see some people like the taste, maybe some hints please.
customer_reviews.author: Frather

customer_reviews.title: DRIPS, PLASTIC, not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this machine because it was supposed to have no plastic in hot water locations. So yeah, the carafe is stainless. But darn near everything else is plastic. AND what really bugs is that this little baby DRIPS. Suuuper anoying to pay premium pricing for what should have cost $40. Coffee is good and hot but how flipping hard is that?
customer_reviews.author: Portland Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee but drips everywhere
customer_reviews.text: The OXO 9-cup coffee maker has been a huge disappointment. It makes great coffee, but it's also one of the drippiest machines I've ever experienced. The spring under the brew basket doesn't seal, allowing coffee to continue dripping after the carafe is removed. The lip of the carafe drips down the side with every single pour. And after just five months of normal household use, the water reservoir has started to leak down the side of the machine. I am seeking a warranty replacement and hoping we just got a lemon.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Haugen

customer_reviews.title: Great value for $, kinda big/bulky
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I like this coffee maker. It did take a few cycles to get the “bitterness” out of it, despite running a couple of plain water cycles through it. It’s reasonably well made, brews quickly, pot stays hot. Only complaints are it’s very tall and kind of bulky—50% bigger then my old zojirushi coffee pt.
customer_reviews.author: P. Bergh

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Coffee Brewer!
customer_reviews.text: Makes a superb cup of coffee. Even a small batch is hot and full bodied. The carafe is the first I have owned that Does Not Drip after a pour. Thermal carafe holds Temp well but isn’t a Thermos so does lose some heat. Pre warming increases hot time. Called Company with Question and got a real person who answered my Question. Have used it daily for 3 weeks and still think it is Great.
customer_reviews.author: Recently there

customer_reviews.title: Great Coffee, Great Aesthetics
customer_reviews.text: Bottom line: It makes great coffee. I wish the pot kept the coffee hotter for longer, however. After the birth of my son, I ran out of time for my various pour-over methods. This coffee maker was purchased in the hope that I could get a similar taste to my manual methods. I'm satisfied enough. The coffee brews and drips pretty quickly. The visual aesthetics are great and it has an auto-start feature.
customer_reviews.author: kaweller

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: Great coffee maker, I love that you can either brew 2-4 cups or 5-9. The only thing is the coffee could be a bit hotter in my opinion but the taste is very smooth. And it looks great on the counter!
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Brennan

customer_reviews.title: Very nice coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: Liked taste of coffee a lot. It does not have a warming plate( but knew when I bought) but I take it with me in a thermos to go or just microwave for second cup so warming plate not needed. Easy to find one piece Metal coffee holder to fit instead of instead of using coffee filters in it
customer_reviews.author: William E.

customer_reviews.title: Great, except...
customer_reviews.text: I loved the Barista Brain. It was easy to use. Kept coffee piping hot. Super easy to clean. And looked great to boot. However, I had to return it for one reason the Brew spout leaks excessively after removing the carafe. It annoyed me to no end. Were it not for that one issue I would have loved to keep it. It's a great piece of equipment. The coffee is delicious down to the last cup.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Addict

customer_reviews.title: Works great and looks great
customer_reviews.text: Works great and looks great. Interface is simple and easy to use. Best maker I have found that offers the delayed start timer. Had to contact customer service because the brew basket drip plug wasn't working and they mailed me a new one and provided return shipping on the defective basket.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Heard

customer_reviews.title: Love, Love!
customer_reviews.text: Love this game changing coffee brewer. I went on a search for a better morning cup that could make coffee similar tasting to my pour-over set-up or percolator without the time spent. Oxo Barista Brain did just that! The machine is simple, looks sleek, and actually, brews HOT coffee that STAYS hot in the carafe. There is an pre-set auto brew option which I value for my early mornings. And lastly, it is capable of holding plenty of coffee grounds which accommodates my preferred ratio of grounds to water for a rich coffee texture and flavor (unlike my last maker). Thank you, thank you, OXO.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea Reyes

customer_reviews.title: Best I’ve found after a long search.
customer_reviews.text: I bought another coffee maker a while back from Amazon that was a nightmare (Capresso — left a review there). Amazon nor Capresso would exchange that one, so I trashed it, did much more research, and bought this OXO. I love it. I do wish the carafe was a bit larger (it’s 9 cups), but so far it’s a dream.
customer_reviews.author: An Ordinary Man in New Haven

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: We HAVE only had it a short time and so far we love it. our last pot leaked and had other problems. this one works perfectly and makes a good cup of coffee. we have started roasting our own beans and this take a while to get the roast down right. But even our grocery store beans taste better with this pot.
customer_reviews.author: LEslie

customer_reviews.title: wonderful coffee!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this coffee maker! My parents recently bought the Moccamaster so I was looking for something of similar quality, but a little bit more affordable. Since this was given the approval of the SCAA, I decided to try it. I am extremely impressed and use it daily-- I even think I like how it brews better than the more expensive Moccamaster. It's very easy to clean and I use it with Melitta Cone Coffee Filters Natural Brown #4 which work perfectly. The timer is easy to change and set daily. Highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 15 months
customer_reviews.text: Made great coffee for 15 months then had issues with the coffee pot sensor. It appeared that the logic didn't know when the pot was on the base or if the brew cycle was done. Had to keep hitting the selector button (approx. 10 times) to get it to get it into the brew cycle.
customer_reviews.author: ds717

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee, but only if you drink it all right away
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the brew is excellent, as many others have said. I'm taking away half a star because the carafe is difficult to clean. I'm taking away one and a half stars because an hour after the coffee is brewed, whatever is left in the carafe is barely lukewarm. Fix the carafe issues and this is the world's best drip coffee maker.
customer_reviews.author: wvjbdan

customer_reviews.title: Stay Away from this Machine
customer_reviews.text: Bought the OXO Brew 9 as was reviewed well by Wire Cutter and others. However, having used the item for a few weeks, I would recommend buying another machine. My biggest complaint is the plastic/rubber taste that still lingers despite dozens of brew cycles. The device is also very large, in my opinion excessively so. The only positive I can give is that the coffee stays warm for a long time...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I like piping hot coffee
customer_reviews.text: Was really hoping to find a consumer-grade coffee machine that delivers a piping hot cup o' joe. Unfortunately this model is not the one. It's just not hot enough for my taste, especially if you add cream to the brew. Sent it back after three test runs. Too bad, it looks cool and seeing the bubbles go up the tube was kinda fun.
customer_reviews.author: Oh, boy

customer_reviews.title: Love this coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: I have used this coffee maker for 6 months now and I really like it. It easy to use, easy to clean and it makes good coffee. The only thing I wish you could do, is take off the reservoir and transport it to fill it with water. I use this everyday and am very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: GraysonT

customer_reviews.title: High-quality coffee from an attractive maker
customer_reviews.text: Did an embarrassing amount of research before making this coffee maker purchase, and I'm really quite happy with it. It looks great on the counter, and makes coffee that's notably better tasting than my previous Cuisinart maker. There is an issue with the electrical engineering on the unit, though, as others have reported -- if I grind coffee with a grinder plugged into the same outlet as the machine, it will reset the clock! Really annoying. I've taken to grinding at a different outlet, but this is the one reason I can't give the OXO 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: A. Zito

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied - keep an eye on the price
customer_reviews.text: Bought this coffeemaker on the advice of Wirecutter, and we love it. Watching the bubbles in the glass reservoir is lots of fun as the coffee brews. Coffee is very good, brew time pretty fast. We like the design of periodic "holding" of water before dripping into the brew basket, to simulate pour-over. We bought this coffeemaker less than a month ago for $130, and the price has gone up considerably since then, so I would recommend shopping around.
customer_reviews.author: Proud English Major

customer_reviews.title: Good coffee maker, Great Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: More than a year after the purchase of this coffee maker I started having trouble with the carafe not registering as being under the filter. I called customer support after a one minute diagnosis they sent me a brand new carafe and all is working as it should. Very pleased with this level of customer service. The coffee maker has made great coffee for the past year and I look forward to many more cups of coffee from this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Have to have a cup every day!
customer_reviews.text: We love it! Our previous coffee machine quit on us and we decided to invest in a better quality brand. Did some research online and a lot of positive feedback about this one. Decided to give it a try and we fell in love with it since the first day. I love the coffee scope that came with it, it makes the brewing process easier and better measurement. The machine itself is bigger than I anticipated but good coffee is what it matters!
customer_reviews.author: DucktownY

customer_reviews.title: Rubber taste killed it. Returned.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to have this at my kitchen, but the rubber taste just killed it. See top rated review for rubber taste problem. I had exact same issue. Tried to do what author suggested in the review, like brew water several times, soak the rubber tube in water to release gas out of it. Nothing helped. Opted for another coffee maker that was cheaper, looked similarly cool, but had glass carafe.
customer_reviews.author: halkazzar

customer_reviews.title: Good, if you receive it with no defects.
customer_reviews.text: Well. Right out of the box the plastic piece at the top of the pot had a big chunk out of it. It wasn’t from shipping because it wasn’t in the box. It happened at their assembly building. Bad QA. And we are trying to return it. I wouldn’t mind replacing it but that option isn’t available. Only a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Pfrederick

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome brewer. Quick brew time. Looks good and modern on countertop. My wife even allows it to stay up and doesn’t hide it . Complaints minimal - carafe does not keep coffee hot or warm very long . Like longer than 30 minutes . The carafe drips when pouring if not careful . The brew head sometimes drips when the carafe is not under it , making a small mess . No big dealbreakers though
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is the one
customer_reviews.text: Oh man this coffee maker is amazing - never thought I would be so eager to offer visitors to my home a cup of coffee but I end up telling everyone how awesome this coffee maker is. Amazing coffee, easy to use. Yes it is large, and yes it can drip a little when you remove the carafe, other than that its awesome. Got it for black friday for $127 - what a deal.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Never thought I would pay this much for a coffee maker.
customer_reviews.text: But wow, what a coffee maker, simplistic, functional, and worth what I paid. My Krupp stainless steel carafe coffee maker went kaput after 10 years. So I went on a long search to find something similar, I'm hard on carafe's and need heavy duty stainless steel. I'm glad I bought the OXO, nice hot coffee even after 2 hours of brewing. I hope it will last as long as my Krupps.
customer_reviews.author: J.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic coffee but leaking somewhere?
customer_reviews.text: The quality of coffee from this is just amazing. I’ve never had a cup of coffee that was as strong and flavorful outside of a coffee shop. Going from a Keurig to this machine was day and night, and as a result I can’t drink coffee from the office anymore. (In fact I’ve nearly got my boss to switch to this coffee maker) The only issue I’ve noticed which started roughly 2 weeks ago is that there seems to be some kind of a leak between the machine and carafe, almost daily after I get my first cup of coffee in the morning there is a small amount of coffee in the indentation where the carafe sits.
customer_reviews.author: Rianna

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I expected a bigger taste difference for the price. It’s just OK. Add to that a lack of many useful features and a strange sensitivity to the “surge” created by my bean grinder (the clock resets if they are on the same outlet, even though no other kitchen device has this problem) and I’m pretty disappointed in this “best overall” pick from Amazon. Spend the money on something else and get one for half the price.
customer_reviews.author: Marc J Phelps

customer_reviews.title: Great customer support
customer_reviews.text: I liked this coffee maker as much as others who have written good reviews. However, I found that the brew basket on my machine was not operating properly -- it wouldn't always shut off the flow when I removed the coffee pot and dripped a bit after brewing. I called OXO support and they will be sending me a replacement. Things sometimes go wrong with products -- but it's all about how the company takes responsibility and handles the resolution. This company gets 5 stars for their immediate and friendly response!
customer_reviews.author: Frangipani

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Have had the OXO for a couple weeks now and really like it. The coffee tastes great and I think it's primarily due to the fact that it brews at the proper temperature. I've found that other brewers simply fail to get the water hot enough. The other thing I find handy (and what distinguishes it from its closest rival) is the drip stop feature that enables you to sneak a half cup before the brewing cycle has concluded.
customer_reviews.author: FBSeattle

customer_reviews.title: Like most OXO products, it works well.
customer_reviews.text: What did I use this product for? Hello, it's a coffee pot. Duh! Seriously, this OXO is excellent. It takes some getting used to because it's unlike other coffee pots. And at 9 cups, it's a bit smaller than our family normally needs. But we've also got a Keurig for those who want something different from what's in the OXO pot. You ask about the flavor from this coffee maker? I think it's the coffee blend that we use that produces the flavor we like, not any specific pot. My daughter has one of these, too; I think we'd both buy it again if the OXO somehow disappeared from our kitchens.
customer_reviews.author: John J.

customer_reviews.title: Leaky basket, but ok otherwise
customer_reviews.text: It’s a fine coffee maker. Easy to use. Coffee tastes fine. But the basket drips much more than any coffee pot I’ve ever had. Grounds basket is still flooded and slowly dripping when timer tells me coffee is ready. It drips so much so that we keep an extra mug and a dish towel nearby when we remove the carafe from the base - a mug to catch drips, and towel for the inevitable small but real mess that this pot creates. And the carafe doesn't keep coffee as warm as other carafes I've used.
customer_reviews.author: C. Duckworth

customer_reviews.title: Does not last
customer_reviews.text: Bought this 6 months ago on the suggestion of the Wirecutter. Now it keeps flashing a red light at me as though it had no water or had no carafe in it. No indication as to what it's computer thinks is the problem. DO NOT BUY THIS
customer_reviews.author: Waltman

customer_reviews.title: Quality control needs to improve
customer_reviews.text: Ordered two of these-sent both back. Good news is the coffee tastes great. Bad news- both machines had problems. First machine tended to push wet coffee grounds over the filter and into carafe. Second one leaked water underneath the electrics! Needless to say, both went back. Wanted to keep this model, but just couldn’t.
customer_reviews.author: T. Runge

customer_reviews.title: Faulty Switch (for $200?!)
customer_reviews.text: Faulty Switch! Paying 200$ for this (simple) coffee machine is a real stretch but we went for it since Wirecutter review. We have to push the on/off button several times to get it to start and we simply don't have the friggen time to re-package and send it back. BUT... NEVER AGAIN. Sorry, for $200 and you can't produce a machine that turns on properly. Bu-bye!
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to purchase an electric coffee maker. I am a coffee snob and have been doing manual pour overs for years. All the reviews I read on electric pour over style coffee makers were very mixed. I finally bit the bullet and purchased this OXO pour over style maker and it has completely impressed me. It's easy to use, easy to clean, and has a timer for automatic starts. It saves me at least 15 minutes in the morning, and I would say the taste is close to 90%-95% of that of an actual manual pour over. I'm curious to see how it perform over time, but I have had it 2 weeks and I'm very satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: JJ P.

customer_reviews.title: I like the coffee that it produced but it was never ...
customer_reviews.text: I had been using the pour over method. I like the coffee that it produced but it was never at optimum temp and I had to make it one cup at a time. Then I found this! Love it! The flavor is great and the temp is perfect for me. I can brew more than one cup and keep it warm for later consumption. I would highly recommend this for everyone who likes to grind their own beans for a fresh, tasty cup. My only complaint is that there is no easy way to clean it.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: Great cup of coffee
customer_reviews.text: Omg. Great cup of coffee!!!!!! I love it. Used Starbucks French roast coffee, had them grind it for paper cone. The OXO barista brain 9 cups brewed a smooth, rich in aroma, full body taste exceptional cup of coffee. Prefect temperature to drink right out of the insulted pot! 5 ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
customer_reviews.author: Paul Y

customer_reviews.title: This is the best coffee maker that I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: The coffee just tastes different. It is rich and yummy and there is a definitive difference from other coffee makers I have owned. I have owned some high end coffee makers and this one wins. Whatever the process is, it works!
customer_reviews.author: a

customer_reviews.title: EXTREMELY HAPPY with this item
customer_reviews.text: EXTREMELY HAPPY with this item. Use it every day. I respond the 1st or 2nd time the machine gives a red light prompt that it wants to be cleaned. And, have only used white vinegar and water to clean. Does an excellent job. Then I run one full pot of clear water to rinse the vinegar. Never had any vinegar taste of build up.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Jade

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: 1) Makes great coffee. However: 2) 4-months in, and I've already got the leaky basket defect. 3) A piece on the top of the pot has already broken off. 4) The tube from the lid through the pot always falls off. I'm already looking for a new machine by another company.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Almost great!
customer_reviews.text: Probably would have given it five stars except: -- it drips too much when you try and pour a cup of coffee before it's done brewing (the valve is not tight enough?). -- related to the issue above, it takes a little too long to brew 6-8 cups of coffee (what I normally brew). -- seemingly randomly the time starts flashing and I have to reset it. -- coffee grounds can get in the water reservoir. Otherwise, I love it! It makes great, hot coffee!
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee, weak carafe handle
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker has so much to love - the easy one-button interface, thermal carafe, great coffee. Only issue is the carafe handle broke for me only a few weeks in. Seems to be only lightly soldered to the unit and didn't take much to snap off. Otherwise love it.
customer_reviews.author: FloridaVacaReader

customer_reviews.title: Perfection every morning
customer_reviews.text: Finally I've been set free from self-inflicted-pour-over slavery. The coffee this creates is consistently perfect. The machine is the nicest looking appliance on my kitchen counter. I truly enjoy pressing the button to start my brew in the morning. I've used the automatic start setting as well and I feel sort of space-age. Buy this lovely coffee maker and release yourself from fussy pour-over brewing.
customer_reviews.author: Yen Lai

customer_reviews.title: Beautifully crafted coffee maker that brews the best tasting coffee.  And it's fun to watch the brew cycle!
customer_reviews.text: No point in repeating all the superlatives already stated in the many other reviews. I'll just add that after owning Cuisinart, Braun and Krups coffee makers, none compare to the OXO. The OXO produces rich, strong coffee with no bitterness. In fact, it is so efficient that I had to reduce the amount of coffee beans to about 2/3 of what I normally use. Moreover, the components are well made and the whole system has a feeling of quality. And, I have to admit, it's fun watching the brewing process with hot water almost silently bubbling up through the center of the reservoir.
customer_reviews.author: glenn

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: We decidedd to replace our 14-year-old Krups coffee maker with one that has a smaller footprint - the OXO On Barista Brain 9 Cup Coffee Maker. Quite a difference in technology over the past decade or two! This coffee maker is much more user friendly and takes up less space than our old one, easier to program and to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Daiv

customer_reviews.title: Great  coffee taste
customer_reviews.text: What a happy surprise this coffee machine is. The "wirecutter" reviewers said one would have to purchase a much much more expensive machine to beat this taste - -- I fully agree with them. buy without reserve. This is one of my best purchase this year.
customer_reviews.author: Claude M.

customer_reviews.title: Good, bold brew.
customer_reviews.text: It is good, easy to clean design coffee maker. The coffee brew is much bolder in flavor. However I am disappointed that it does not stay hot long enough to drink the whole pot. The thermal carafe does not hold heat well, or the coffee is just not brewed at high enough temp. I have lovingly been drinking coffee 35 years, and want my coffee to be nice and hot. Perhaps I should be got the model that had glass pot, and warmer plate. Wish I could swap it out!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.description: Style:9 Cup Coffee MakerThe OXO 9-Cup Coffee Maker controls brewing time, water temperature and volume for rich, flavorful coffee at the push of a button. The double-wall stainless steel thermal carafe keeps your coffee piping hot, while the internal mixing tube ensures your last sip is as delicious as your first. With a pause and pour feature, automatic wake-up timer and freshness indicator; the OXO Brew 9-Cup Coffee Maker is recognized as an exemplary home brewer by the SCA (Specialty Coffee Association) for delivering rich, gold-standard coffee – every time.
